info.title: API Reference - Postcodes.io
info.description:
# Overview

Postcodes.io is a free postcode lookup API and geocoder for the UK.

## Endpoint

All services can be accessed from the following endpoint.

```
https://api.postcodes.io
```

The API accepts GET and POST requests. POST methods use content type `application/json`.

## Responses

Each response comes with an appropriate HTTP Status code (except for JSONP requests). These include 200 for success, 400 for a bad request, 404 for not found and 500 for server error. The HTTP Status code is also included in the response body.

## Authentication

Postcodes.io does not require authentication.

externalDocs.description: More on our APIs, libraries with guides and examples

get.description:
### Postcode Data (Ordnance Survey Postcode Directory Dataset)

Data points returned by the /postcodes and /outcodes API

Query for a postcode either by:

- The postcode itself (with `query=`) or by,
- A geolocation (`lat=` and `lon=`).

## Query with Postcode

Submit a postcode query and receive a complete list of postcode matches and all associated postcode data. This is triggered when `query=` is supplied.

This is essentially a postcode search which prefix matches and returns postcodes in sorted order (case insensitive).

This method is space sensitive, i.e. it detects for spaces between outward and inward parts of the postcode (some examples detailed in this [issue](https://github.com/ideal-postcodes/postcodes.io/issues/44)).

The result set can either be empty or populated with up to 100 postcode entities. Either way it will always return a 200 response code.

## Query with Geolocation

Returns nearest postcodes for a given longitude and latitude. This is triggered when `lat=` and `lon=` are supplied.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Limits number of postcodes matches to return. Defaults to 10. Needs to be less than 100.

parameters.name: longitude
parameters.description: Geographic coordinate that specifies the east-west position of a point

parameters.name: radius
parameters.description: Limits number of postcodes matches to return. Defaults to 100m. Needs to be less than 2,000m.

schema.title: Widesearch
schema.description: Search up to 20km radius, but subject to a maximum of 10 results. Since lookups over a wide area can be very expensive, we've created this method to allow you choose to make the trade off between search radius and number of results. Defaults to false. When enabled, radius and limits over 10 are ignored.

schema.title: Filter
schema.description: A comma separated whitelist of attributes to be returned in the result object(s), e.g. filter=postcode,longitude,latitude. null responses will continue to return null. If no attributes match the result object, an empty object is returned

post.description:
Accepts a JSON object containing an array of postcodes. Returns a list of matching postcodes and respective available data.

Be sure to submit JSON requests setting `Content-Type` to `application/json`.

Accepts up to 100 postcodes.

### Post Data

This method requires a JSON object containing an array of postcodes to be posted, e.g.

```json
{
  "postcodes": ["PR3 0SG", "M45 6GN", "EX16 5BL"]
}
```

## Bulk Reverse Geocoding

Bulk translates geolocations into Postcodes. Accepts up to 100 geolocations.

get.description: Returns a list of postcodes geographically nearest to the specified postcode, ordered by proximity (closest first).

parameters.name: postcode
parameters.description: Valid UK postcode to use as the geographic center point for the proximity search

get.description: Returns a randomly selected postcode along with comprehensive geographic, administrative, and statistical data associated with that postcode.

parameters.name: outcode
parameters.description: Filters random postcodes by outcode. Returns null if invalid outcode.

get.description:
Lookup a terminated postcode.

If the terminated postcode exists, this API returns the date of termination and last known geospatial coordinates.

Returns `404` if postcode does not exist in our database of terminated postcodes or is not valid.

Source: Ordnance Survey Postcode Directory Dataset

Lookup a Scottish postcode.

Returns Scottish Postcode Directory (SPD) data associated with postcode. At the moment this is just Scottish Parliamentary Constituency.

Returns `404` if postcode does not exist in SPD or is not valid.

For postcodes not in SPD but in ONSPD, a 404 is returned with the error message "Postcode exists in ONSPD but not in SPD."

Source: Scottish Postcode Directory

parameters.name: postcode
parameters.description: Specifies the postcode you wish to query

get.description:
Returns aggregated information for postcodes grouped by their shared outward code.

The outward code is the first half of any postcode (3-4 characters and followed by a space). E.g. `SW1A` is the outward code for `SW1A 1AA`.

parameters.name: outcode
parameters.description: Specifies the outward code you wish to query.

get.description: Submit a place query and receive a complete list of places matches and associated data.

Submit a place query and receive a complete list of place matches and associated data.

This API uses the Ordnance Survey Open Names Dataset. Places are not available for Northern Ireland.

parameters.name: code
parameters.description: Specifies the place you wish to query

get.description: Returns a randomly selected place from the database along with all its associated geographical and administrative data. Useful for testing or displaying sample location data.

postcode.title: Postcode
postcode.description: UK postcode format: 2-4 character outward code, a space, and a 3-character inward code (e.g., SW1A 2AA). Updated monthly from Royal Mail.

outcode.title: Outward Code
outcode.description: The first part of a postcode before the space (2-4 characters). This generally identifies the postal town or district.

incode.title: Inward Code
incode.description: The second part of a postcode after the space (always 3 characters). Helps identify specific streets or buildings within a postal area.

quality.title: Positional Quality
quality.description:
Indicates accuracy of the grid reference location:

* 1: Within the actual building (most accurate)
* 2: Same as 1, but verified by Landline maps (Scotland only)
* 3: Approximate location within 50m
* 4: Postcode unit mean (averaged from addresses with same postcode)
* 5: Estimated by ONS using surrounding postcodes
* 6: Postcode sector mean (mainly PO Boxes)
* 8: Historical postcode (pre-Gridlink®)
* 9: No grid reference available

eastings.title: Eastings
eastings.description: Ordnance Survey grid reference easting (X-coordinate) with 1-meter resolution. May be null if geolocation unavailable.

northings.title: Northings
northings.description: Ordnance Survey grid reference northing (Y-coordinate) with 1-meter resolution. May be null if geolocation unavailable.

country.title: Country
country.description: The UK constituent country for this postcode (England, Scotland, Wales, Northern Ireland, Channel Islands, or Isle of Man).

nhs_ha.title: Strategic Health Authority
nhs_ha.description: The NHS health authority area for this postcode.

admin_county.title: County
admin_county.description: The administrative county for this postcode. May be empty for areas without county-level administration.

admin_district.title: District
admin_district.description: The administrative district or unitary authority for this postcode.

admin_ward.title: Ward
admin_ward.description: The electoral/administrative ward for this postcode.

longitude.title: Longitude
longitude.description: WGS84 longitude coordinate (east-west position). May be null if geolocation unavailable.

latitude.title: Latitude
latitude.description: WGS84 latitude coordinate (north-south position). May be null if geolocation unavailable.

parliamentary_constituency.title: Westminster Parliamentary Constituency
parliamentary_constituency.description: The UK Parliamentary constituency for this postcode.

european_electoral_region.title: European Electoral Region (EER)
european_electoral_region.description: The European Electoral Region for this postcode.

primary_care_trust.title: Primary Care Trust (PCT)
primary_care_trust.description: The healthcare administrative area for this postcode. Different naming conventions apply across UK regions.

region.title: Region
region.description: The regional designation for this postcode (formerly Government Office Regions or GORs).

parish.title: Parish/Community
parish.description: The civil parish (England) or community (Wales) for this postcode.

lsoa.title: Lower Layer Super Output Area
lsoa.description: 2011 Census LSOA code (smaller statistical area, typically 1,000-1,500 residents).

msoa.title: Middle Layer Super Output Area
msoa.description: 2011 Census MSOA code (mid-size statistical area, typically 5,000-7,000 residents).

ced.title: County Electoral District
ced.description: The county electoral division for English postcodes. Will be null for postcodes without a grid reference or in other UK regions.

ccg.title: Clinical Commissioning Group
ccg.description: NHS Clinical Commissioning Group responsible for planning healthcare services in England.

nuts.title: International Territorial Levels (ITL)
nuts.description:
Statistical geography code for international comparisons (formerly NUTS - Nomenclature of Units for Territorial Statistics).

As of January 2021, following Brexit, NUTS was replaced by ITL (International Territorial Levels) in the UK.
For backward compatibility, Postcodes.io continues to provide this data under the "nuts" field name.

codes.title: Administrative Codes
codes.description: Standard 9-character codes (ONS/GSS) for various administrative boundaries. Useful for data linking with official statistics.

admin_district.title: District GSS Code
admin_district.description: Official 9-character GSS code for this administrative district.

admin_county.title: County GSS Code
admin_county.description: Official 9-character GSS code for this administrative county.

admin_ward.title: Ward GSS Code
admin_ward.description: Official 9-character GSS code for this administrative ward.

parish.title: Parish GSS Code
parish.description: Official 9-character GSS code for this parish.

ccg.title: CCG GSS Code
ccg.description: Official 9-character GSS code for this Clinical Commissioning Group.

ccg_id.title: CCG ID
ccg_id.description: Short code identifier for this Clinical Commissioning Group.

ced.title: CED GSS Code
ced.description: Official 9-character GSS code for this County Electoral District.

nuts.title: ITL Code
nuts.description: Official code for this International Territorial Level area.

lau2.title: LAU2 Code
lau2.description: Local Administrative Unit level 2 code for this area.

lsoa.title: LSOA GSS Code
lsoa.description: Official 9-character GSS code for this Lower Layer Super Output Area.

msoa.title: MSOA GSS Code
msoa.description: Official 9-character GSS code for this Middle Layer Super Output Area.

result.description: Comprehensive location data including geographic coordinates, administrative boundaries, and electoral information for the requested postcode
Array containing detailed location information for the requested postcode or nearest postcodes

NearestPostcode.title: Geolocated Postcode
NearestPostcode.description: Standard postcode object extended with a distance attribute, indicating how far the postcode is from a supplied geolocation.

distance.title: Distance from supplied geolocation
distance.description: Distance in metres from specified postcode

result.description: Array of nearest postcodes sorted by distance

postcode.title: Postcode
postcode.description: UK postal code format that has been terminated. Follows the standard format of 2-4 character outward code, a space, then 3-character inward code.

year_terminated.title: Termination year
year_terminated.description: The year when the postcode was terminated (YYYY format).

month_terminated.title: Termination month
month_terminated.description: Month when the postcode was terminated (1-12, where 1=January, 12=December).

longitude.title: Longitude
longitude.description: WGS84 longitude coordinate of the postcode location.

latitude.title: Latitude
latitude.description: WGS84 latitude coordinate of the postcode location.

postcode.title: Postcode
postcode.description: The Royal Mail postcode associated with this location (e.g., IV2 7JB)

scottish_parliamentary_constituency.title: Scottish Parliamentary Constituency
scottish_parliamentary_constituency.description: The name of the 2014 Scottish Parliamentary Constituency for this location

codes.title: Location Codes
codes.description: Official identification codes associated with this postcode location

scottish_parliamentary_constituency.title: Scottish Parliamentary Constituency Code
scottish_parliamentary_constituency.description: The 9-character GSS/ONS code identifying the 2014 Scottish Parliamentary Constituency (format: S#######)

outcode.title: Outcode
outcode.description: First part of the postcode before the space (e.g., "SW1A" in "SW1A 1AA"). Usually 2-4 characters.

eastings.title: Eastings
eastings.description: Ordnance Survey eastings coordinate (1m resolution). Returns 0 if location unavailable.

northings.title: Northings
northings.description: Ordnance Survey northings coordinate (1m resolution). Returns 0 if location unavailable.

longitude.title: Longitude
longitude.description: WGS84 longitude coordinate. May be null if location unavailable.

latitude.title: Latitude
latitude.description: WGS84 latitude coordinate. May be null if location unavailable.

parish.title: Parish
parish.description: Parishes (England) or communities (Wales) within this outcode.

result.description: Comprehensive geographical and administrative data for the specified outcode, including location coordinates, administrative boundaries, and related postal information

Place.title: Place
Place.description: A geographical location with detailed information including names, coordinates, and administrative boundaries

code.title: Code
code.description: Unique identifier for the place record (persistent except for Section of Named/Numbered Roads)

name_1.title: Primary Name
name_1.description: Official name of the place (preserves original format, e.g., "The Pennines" not "Pennines, The")

name_1_lang.title: Primary Name Language
name_1_lang.description: Language code for name_1 (cym=Welsh, eng=English, gla=Scottish Gaelic)

name_2.title: Secondary Name
name_2.description: Alternative name in a different language

name_2_lang.title: Secondary Name Language
name_2_lang.description: Language code for name_2 (cym=Welsh, eng=English, gla=Scottish Gaelic)

local_type.title: Local Type
local_type.description: Ordnance Survey classification (City, Town, Village, Hamlet, etc.)

outcode.title: Outcode
outcode.description: Postcode district (first part of the postcode)

county_unitary.title: Administrative Area
county_unitary.description: County, Unitary Authority or Greater London Authority that contains this place

county_unitary_type.title: Administrative Area Type
county_unitary_type.description: Type of administrative unit (e.g., County, UnitaryAuthority)

district_borough.title: District or Borough
district_borough.description: District, Metropolitan District or London Borough containing this place

region.title: Region
region.description: European Region (formerly Government Office Region) containing this place

country.title: Country
country.description: Country within Great Britain (England, Scotland, or Wales)

eastings.title: Eastings
eastings.description: Ordnance Survey grid reference Easting (1m resolution, not available for Channel Islands/Isle of Man)

northings.title: Northings
northings.description: Ordnance Survey grid reference Northing (1m resolution, not available for Channel Islands/Isle of Man)

min_eastings.title: Minimum Eastings
min_eastings.description: Western edge of the place's bounding box (Minimum Bounding Rectangle)

min_northings.title: Minimum Northings
min_northings.description: Southern edge of the place's bounding box (Minimum Bounding Rectangle)

max_eastings.title: Maximum Eastings
max_eastings.description: Eastern edge of the place's bounding box (Minimum Bounding Rectangle)

max_northings.title: Maximum Northings
max_northings.description: Northern edge of the place's bounding box (Minimum Bounding Rectangle)
